attributes.action:
Refund fees for private candidates who were supposed 
to sit exams in this year
attributes.additional_details: With Private candidates paying around anywhere from £175- £400+ per subject and now not even having to sit the exams, the government should work with the exam boards to find a compromise and refund the fees.
attributes.background: Private candidates who are learning/revising at home who do not attend a school or college and had to pay a local centre to sit their exams in the summer, should get a refund as they no longer require the services of the centres/invigilators or the examiners.

rejection.details:
Refunds for private exam candidates are for exam centres, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition asking for the Government to reimburse private exam candidates who have been unable to get a refund, if that's something that you'd like to happen. 

Please note that you'll need to use your full name if you start a new petition.
